intro: Rotheca myricoides subsp. ussukumae, commonly known as the Ussukumae rotheca, is a shrub native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local communities.
